other_tests.findings: Biopsy of the new small shiny papules revealed slight acanthosis and the presence of round, homogeneous, eosinophilic material in the superficial papillary dermis, with a sparse superficial perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate. Congo red stain confirmed the presence of amyloid and a diagnosis of lichen amyloidosis was made.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The lesions of lichen amyloidosis showed no change at the last follow-up.

other_tests.findings: A second biopsy from a larger plaque revealed marked hyperkeratosis, wedge-shaped hypergranulosis, irregular acanthosis, band-like lymphocytic infiltrate along the dermoepidermal junction and hydropic degeneration of the basal cell layer and necrotic keratinocytes.
Initially given oral etretinate 30 mg/d, leading to significant improvement in pruritus and flattening of hypertrophic lichen planus lesions.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Lesions of hypertrophic lichen planus flattened to normal skin level; however, no change was observed in the lesions of lichen amyloidosis, even with increased doses of etretinate.
